story.title: #WitchesAndWickedBodies Q&A
story.description: Curators Giulia Bartrum and Deanna Petherbridge joined us for a Twitter Q&A about the exhibition Witches and wicked bodies in Room 90 (25 September 2014 â€“ 11 January 2015)

author.name: British Museum
author.bio: A museum of the world, for the world.

quote.text: @britishmuseum Were there witch trials in Britain?

user.description: Writer. Published 2013: SHADOWWATER. Click link below for more info. Sequel now with editor. Blogger, citizen of global community & master of perseverance.
user.name: Wendy Shreve

meta.text: @britishmuseum Were there witch trials in Britain?

quote.text: Certainly. The Berwick witch trials in Scotland (King James), the Pendle witch trials in Lancashire and many more. #WitchesAndWickedBodies

user.description: A museum of the world, for the world. #8mummies http://t.co/P9VkYJxslo #Ming50Years http://t.co/KErWhltSGy #MemoriesOfANation http://t.co/e2xBN0lXJu
user.name: British Museum

meta.text: Certainly. The Berwick witch trials in Scotland (King James), the Pendle witch trials in Lancashire and many more. #WitchesAndWickedBodies

quote.text: During the 17th C. there was also a Witchfinder General, Matthew Hopkins, who published a booklet which influenced the Salem witch trials

user.description: A museum of the world, for the world. #8mummies http://t.co/P9VkYJxslo #Ming50Years http://t.co/KErWhltSGy #MemoriesOfANation http://t.co/e2xBN0lXJu

user.name: Georgey Routen

meta.text: @britishmuseum What impact did the growth of print media have on the level of persecution? #WitchesAndWickedBodies

quote.text: The development of printing technology widely publicised the theories of demonology, which had an effect on subsequent trials

quote.text: @britishmuseum When witch hunting came to end was there official acknowledgement of wrong doing and innocents killed? Any monuments in UK?

user.name: Rebecca Lewis

meta.text: @britishmuseum When witch hunting came to end was there official acknowledgement of wrong doing and innocents killed? Any monuments in UK?

quote.text: The last person prosecuted for witchcraft in the UK was Helen Duncan, imprisoned for 9 months in 1944. Read more here http://t.co/V7EVK7FgWr
